title: 1.3: Implement data/loader.py - centralized data loading
description:
Create centralized data loading module with caching for all parquet and NPZ files.

PARENT: Phase 1 Foundation
DEPENDS ON: 1.2 config.py

WHY: Single loader module with @st.cache_data prevents redundant reads and ensures consistent data access patterns. Graceful error handling shows user-friendly messages when files missing.

FUNCTIONS TO IMPLEMENT:
1. load_sakt_student_state() -> pd.DataFrame
2. load_sakt_predictions() -> pd.DataFrame  
3. load_sakt_attention() -> pd.DataFrame
4. load_skill_mastery() -> pd.DataFrame
5. load_item_params() -> pd.DataFrame
6. load_item_drift() -> pd.DataFrame
7. load_bandit_state() -> Dict[str, np.ndarray]
8. load_canonical_events() -> pd.DataFrame
9. load_training_metrics(model_name: str) -> pd.DataFrame
10. load_prepared_data(split: str, model: str) -> pd.DataFrame

CACHING STRATEGY: Use @st.cache_data decorator on all loaders. Cache invalidation via manual refresh button (implemented in Phase 7).

DATA VALIDATION: Check for required columns, log warnings for schema mismatches.

VERIFICATION:
- All loaders work with production data
- Caching works (second call instant)
- Missing files show friendly errors
- Type hints correct
notes: Implemented streamlit_app/data/loader.py with cached readers for all SAKT/WD-IRT artifacts, canonical events, split manifests, pyKT data_config, and bandit state, each with metadata + missing-data warnings.

title: Phase 1: Foundation - Project Structure & Core Infrastructure
description:
EPIC: Set up the foundational architecture for the Streamlit dashboard.

CONTEXT & RATIONALE:
This is Phase 1 of a 7-phase implementation to build a comprehensive Streamlit dashboard with 24 animated/interactive visualizations for Product/Business stakeholders. The dashboard provides insights into the dual-engine learning analytics system (SAKT + WD-IRT) and validates data pipeline quality.

WHY THIS MATTERS:
- Product stakeholders need visibility into model predictions, student mastery, and data quality
- Current system has no UI - all insights locked in parquet files and terminal outputs
- Animation-first approach (inspired by Central Flows) makes complex data stories understandable
- Static data mode chosen for initial release (manual refresh) to simplify architecture

OVERARCHING GOALS:
1. Make ML model insights accessible to non-technical stakeholders
2. Build trust in data pipeline through transparency (lineage, quality metrics)
3. Enable exploration of student learning patterns and recommendation explanations
4. Provide actionable insights (gaming detection, item health alerts, mastery timelines)

PHASE 1 GOALS:
- Create clean project structure following Streamlit multipage conventions
- Implement centralized data loading with caching (@st.cache_data)
- Build reusable component library (animated charts, metrics, tables)
- Ensure graceful handling of missing data files
- Set up landing page with navigation

TECHNICAL DECISIONS:
- Streamlit: Fastest path to interactive dashboards for Python data
- Plotly: Rich animation support (animation_frame, transitions, network graphs)
- Networkx: Graph layouts for attention mapping and lineage visualization
- Static data mode: Load from parquet on startup, manual refresh button (simpler than live DB)
- Component-based architecture: Reusable chart builders ensure visual consistency

DATA SOURCES (all parquet files in reports/, checkpoints/, data/):
- reports/sakt_student_state.parquet (28.2 MB, 3.23M rows)
- reports/sakt_predictions.parquet (27.8 MB, 3.19M rows)
- reports/sakt_attention.parquet (2.8 MB, 34.8K rows)
- reports/skill_mastery.parquet (4.6 MB, 223.7K rows)
- reports/item_params.parquet (49 KB, 1,835 items)
- reports/item_drift.parquet (24.8 KB, 1,835 items)
- reports/bandit_state.npz (2.1 KB)
- data/canonical/events.parquet
- checkpoints/sakt_kt/version_*/metrics.csv
- checkpoints/wd_irt/version_*/metrics.csv

DEPENDENCIES: None (first phase)
BLOCKS: Phase 2-7 (all visualization pages depend on this foundation)

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- streamlit_app/ directory created with proper structure
- All data loaders implemented with caching
- All 7 chart builder functions working (with animation support)
- Landing page loads without errors
- Navigation sidebar shows 5 pages
notes: Foundational Streamlit scaffolding delivered via Epic A (config, loaders, components, requirements, landing page).

title: Phase 2: Student Insights Page - 6 Visualizations
description:
EPIC: Implement Student Insights page with 6 visualizations for student mastery analysis.

PARENT: Overall dashboard project
DEPENDS ON: Phase 1 Foundation (all core infrastructure must be complete)

CONTEXT:
Student Insights is Page 1 of the dashboard - the primary entry point for educators and stakeholders analyzing individual student performance. This page answers: How is this student performing? What skills are they mastering? Why did the model predict this outcome?

WHY THIS PAGE MATTERS:
- Educators need to understand individual student learning trajectories
- Explainability builds trust in model predictions (not a black box)
- Gaming detection identifies students abusing the system
- Attention visualization reveals what the model focuses on

6 VISUALIZATIONS TO IMPLEMENT:

1.1 Student Dashboard (metrics + distribution)
1.2 Student Mastery Timeline (ANIMATED - high priority)
1.3 Explainability Card (WHY this prediction)
1.4 Skill Radar Chart (multi-skill overview)
1.5 Gaming Detection Console (alert panel)
1.6 Attention Heatmap (INTERACTIVE - medium priority)

ANIMATION PRIORITIES:
- HIGH: 1.2 Mastery Timeline (play through sequence positions)
- MEDIUM: 1.6 Attention Heatmap (smooth transitions between students)
- LOW: 1.4 Skill Radar (smooth transitions)

SHARED FEATURES:
- Student selector in sidebar (filters all visualizations)
- Linked selections via st.session_state
- Rich hover tooltips with item IDs, skills, correctness
- Graceful degradation if data missing

DATA DEPENDENCIES:
- skill_mastery.parquet (dashboard, radar)
- sakt_student_state.parquet (timeline)
- sakt_attention.parquet (explainability, heatmap, mapping)
- canonical_events.parquet (gaming detection, skill enrichment)

SUCCESS CRITERIA:
- All 6 visualizations render without errors
- Student selector updates all charts reactively
- Mastery timeline plays smoothly with controls
- Explainability shows top influential interactions
- Gaming detection flags suspicious patterns
- Attention heatmap allows zoom/pan exploration
notes: Student Insights page now includes metric grid, mastery distribution, animated timeline joined with canonical events, radar chart, explainability table + attention heatmap, and gaming detection console.

title: Fix bandit matrix inversion risk in predict()
description: src/common/bandit.py:87 calls np.linalg.inv(self.A) which can fail if A is singular. Use np.linalg.solve() instead or add regularization to prevent numerical instability.

title: Sanitize LLM prompt inputs to prevent injection
description: src/common/llm_explainability.py directly interpolates user_id and skill_name into LLM prompts without sanitization. Malicious inputs like 'user_id=123\n\nIGNORE PREVIOUS INSTRUCTIONS' could manipulate prompt structure. Add input validation.

title: CRITICAL: Fix WD-IRT model indentation syntax error
description: Lines 95 and 106 in src/wd_irt/model.py have incorrect 8-space indentation instead of 4-space. This causes syntax errors at runtime. Fix: Change indentation from 8 spaces to 4 spaces on both lines.

title: Cache LinUCB matrix inverse to improve prediction performance
description: src/common/bandit.py:87 recomputes matrix inversion O(n³) on every predict() call. When scoring 100 items, this is 100x slower than needed. Fix: Cache A_inv and update incrementally, or use Woodbury matrix identity.

title: Optimize explainability DataFrame filtering performance
description: src/common/explainability.py:128-138 does O(N*k) DataFrame scans in a loop. For each key_factor, it filters the entire events_df. Fix: Build lookup dict once before the loop using set_index().

title: Add tests for LLM explainability module
description: src/common/llm_explainability.py has no test coverage. Add tests with mocked API calls for OpenAI and Anthropic integrations, fallback behavior, and error handling.
